TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ActivityPreviewDesigner extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Displays a collection of child activity designers in a preview strip and, when a child designer is selected on the preview strip, displays the selected activity designer in preview or edit mode on a workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> is a sequential activity designer that displays all of its child activity designers in a strip that appears at the top of its design surface. When one of the child designers is selected, its representation is displayed in a preview window that the activity preview designer hosts below the strip. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> has a preview mode and an edit mode. Preview mode allows the user to view the entire representation of the selected designer without scrolling; however, preview mode does not allow the user to modify the selected activity designer. Edit mode allows the user to modify the selected activity designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.EnsureVisibleContainedDesigner%2A> verifies that all activity designers in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner>, and their children, are displayed in the preview strip at the top of the designer.

Docs.summary: Gets the first selectable object in the navigation order of the .
Docs.value: An that is the first selectable object in the designer navigation order.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner.Expanded%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsVisible%2A> do not contain null references (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.FirstSelectableObject%2A> will return the value of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Activity%2A> property of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.PreviewedDesigner%2A>. If the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Activity%2A> property contains a null reference (`Nothing`), <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.FirstSelectableObject%2A> will return the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> associated with the first designer in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.ContainedDesigners%2A> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle[] GetConnectors() cil managed
Protected Friend Overrides Function GetConnectors () As Rectangle()

Docs.summary: Returns an array of rectangles that bound the activity designer's connectors.
Docs.returns: A array that defines the bounds of all connectors in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.GetConnectors%2A> returns an empty array if one or more of the following conditions occur:
- The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> is not the active designer on the workflow design surface.
- The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> does not contain any child activity designer.
- The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> is not expanded on the workflow design surface.
- <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.ShowPreview%2A> is set to `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `dropPoint` is in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> preview strip, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.GetDropTargets%2A> returns the possible drop targets in the strip.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Size OnLayoutSize(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function OnLayoutSize (e As ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs) As Size

Docs.param: The that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Sets the size of the visual cues on the designers contained within the .
Docs.returns: The that contains the new size settings for the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> determines the size of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner> preview strip that displays the collection of child activity designers and the preview window that displays the selected activity designer. <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> also determines the size of the preview window depending on whether the designer is in edit or preview mode.
If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner.Expanded%2A> returns `false`, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> returns the base implementation inherited from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner>.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property Verbs As ActivityDesignerVerbCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of verbs to associate with the .
Docs.value: An that contains the verbs associated with .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner.Verbs%2A> property to insert custom verb actions for a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityPreviewDesigner>. The `CreateActivityVerbs` creates a new <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerVerb> named `"Add New Parallel Branch"` and associates an event handler named `OnAddParallelBranch`. When the verb is clicked in the workflow designer, the event handler is called.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#73](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#73)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#73](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#73)]
